Description: Body sherd with horizontal handle root of East Greek, possibly Aeolian, grey ware pottery vessel, probably a krater; interior reserved; exterior: dark grey slip and decoration in relief consisting of tendril and dot.
Curator's comments: The fabric and decorative techinques find parallels with British Museum 1888, 0601.644.c. This sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton. The sherd finds parallels with British Museum 1888,0601.644.a. and British Museum 1924,1201.47.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.117)
